005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node.INodeItem;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IMetapathQueryable;
010
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.stream.Collectors;
013import java.util.stream.Stream;
014
015import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
016
017/**
018 * A named segment of a path that can be formatted.
019 */
020public interface IPathSegment extends IMetapathQueryable {
021  /**
022   * Get the path for this node item using the provided formatter.
023   *
024   * @param formatter
025   *          the path formatter to use to produce the path
026   *
027   * @return the formatted path
028   */
029  @NonNull
030  default String toPath(@NonNull IPathFormatter formatter) {
031    return formatter.format(this);
032  }
033
034  /**
035   * Apply formatting for the path segment. This is a visitor pattern that will be
036   * called to format each segment in a larger path.
037   *
038   * @param formatter
039   *          the path formatter
040   * @return a textual representation of the path segment
041   */
042  @NonNull
043  String format(@NonNull IPathFormatter formatter);
044
045  /**
046   * Get a list of path segments, starting at the root and descending.
047   *
048   * @return a list of path segments in descending order
049   */
050  @SuppressWarnings("null")
051  @NonNull
052  default List<IPathSegment> getPath() {
053    return getPathStream().collect(Collectors.toUnmodifiableList());
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Get a stream of path segments, starting at the root and descending.
058   *
059   * @return a stream of path segments in descending order
060   */
061  @NonNull
062  Stream<? extends IPathSegment> getPathStream();
063
064  /**
065   * Get the value associated with the path segment.
066   *
067   * @return the value or {@code} if no value is associated with this path segment
068   */
069  @Override
070  INodeItem getNodeItem();
071}
